etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Conodonta (plural), from Greek kōnos ‘cone’ + odous, odont- ‘tooth’

definitions: a fossil marine animal of the Cambrian to Triassic periods, having a long wormlike body, numerous small teeth, and a pair of eyes. It is now believed to be the earliest vertebrate.

notes.text: Class Conodonta, phylum Chordata: numerous families

shortDefinitions: fossil marine animal with long wormlike body

definitions: a tooth of the conodont animal, often found as a fossil.
shortDefinitions: tooth of conodont, often found as fossil
